info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 4:22AM CDT until June 14 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
San Antonio River Near Elmendorf affecting Bexar and Wilson Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Antonio River near Elmendorf.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 39.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding damages crops and floods pastureland below San Antonio to below Floresville. Secondary roads and low bridges, irrigation pumps, oil field pump jacks and tank batteries flood. Livestock are cut off in low areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 37.3 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.2 feet on 06/29/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
